article.headline: N. Colorado 55, Weber St. 52
article.story: GREELEY, Colo. (AP) -- Jabril Banks had 18 points and 10 rebounds, and Thanasi Panagiotakopoulos added a season high 15 points as Northern Colorado upset defending Big Sky Conference champion Weber State 55-52 Sunday. Northern Colorado improved to 7-8 overall and 2-2 in conference play, tying its total number of conference wins from a year ago, its first season in the league. With 52 seconds left, Panagiotakopoulos hit a 3-pointer to give the Bears a 50-49 lead. Panagiotakopoulos and Banks combined for five free throws, and the Bears held Weber State (5-8, 0-1) to a 3-pointer the rest of the way for the win. The Bears trailed 27-24 at halftime after shooting 30 percent from the field. Weber State made just 34.5 percent of its shots from the field in the half. Kellen McCoy was the lone Weber State scorer to hit double digits with 13 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
